sentence.Network_en: The church seems to be on the brink of schism.
sentence.Network_cn: 教会似乎处于分裂的边缘。

sentence.Network_en: We are much too apt to look at schism in our church as an unmitigated evil.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们太容易把自己教会中的分立看成是十恶不赦的.

sentence.Network_en: While some predict schism, others predict a good old fashioned compromise.
sentence.Network_cn: 在有些人预测分裂的同时, 另一些人预测了有益的老式妥协.

list.abs: great schism of the Catholic Church ., 天主教会大分裂.
new modern Confucianism , emerged in the 1920s , is an academic schism which is based on the theory of Confucianism and assimilates sciences .现代新儒家是产生于二十世纪二十年代，以儒家学说为本位来吸纳、会通西学的学术流派。
but it was in the more normal sexual relations in the home that this schism produced its most revolutionary effects .然而，在家庭里比较正常的两性关系中，这种裂痕导致了非常革命的后果。
...裂症家庭成员中常有相互对抗的派别，使家庭成员之间的关系成为分裂（schism）现象。于是，他提出了“婚姻分裂（marital schism)”和“婚姻偏斜(marital skew)”两个概念，来表示夫妻之间性格过强而影响到夫妻关系甚至家庭.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French scisme, via ecclesiastical Latin from Greek skhisma 'cleft', from skhizein 'to split'

entry.tran: (由于思想、信仰不同造成的)分裂，分离
entry.def: When there is a schism, a group or organization divides into two groups as a result of differences in thinking and beliefs.

example.ex: ...the great schism which divided the Christian world in the 11th century...
example.tran: 11 世纪划分基督教世界的大规模教会分裂

example.ex: The church seems to be on the brink of schism.
example.tran: 教会似乎处于分裂的边缘。

means.word_mean: 1. division of a group into opposing factions;

sentences.sentence: "another schism like that and they will wind up in bankruptcy"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"具备某种性质"; 2. 表示"学术或学术流派,行业"; 3. 表示"行为,现象,状态"; 4. 表示"疾病"; 5. 名词,表示"各种主义,宗教"
